intro: Micromeria capitellata, commonly known as the desert sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing shrub with small, narrow leaves and clusters of pink to purple flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as succulent stems and reduced leaf surfaces to minimize water loss. Its flowers are typically visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological role in desert ecosystems. Micromeria capitellata is also valued for its ornamental appeal and resilience in challenging conditions.
